It Is good to have you as chairman of the publications
committee* At this stage in our career we have quite a number
of problems to face and decisions to make in this area, and I
am very glad that you are available to help us do this*
Well, Ed, these are a few comments from me, with, you will
note, carbons to Harry and Frank. From some further letter ex¬
changes and the Columbus meeting of your committee, should easily
grow a brief description of its functions*
With best personal regards.
Yours sincerely.
